contenido: Numbers 1-20 The alphabet Name ID Number Telephone number e-mail.
What’s Personal pronoun my.

Greetings Basic small talk Leave-taking Formal / informal language Please / Thank you
What’s your name? Can you spell that? What’s your ID number? What’s your telephone number?What’s your e-mail?
/aI/ Hi, Bye, I’m fine.

Understand basic greetings and leave-takings, including level of formality.
Understand basic small talk and turn-taking.
Understand requests for basic personal information.
Understand letters and numbers.

Carry out basic greetings and leave-takings with different levels of formality. Carry out basic small talk and turn-taking. Answer requests for basic personal information. Spell names and give phone numbers, e-mail addresses.
Understand very basic forms and registration questionnaires for websites, etc.
Complete very basic forms and registration questionnaires for websites, etc.
Personal Information Occupations Interests Studies.

I’m an / a S/he is a / an
I like … I like to …
I’m from… I live in…

Basic personal information Small talk.
Where are you from? Where do you live?
What do you do? What do you like?

Linking with an.
Word stress occupations.
Understand requests for personal information including occupation and interests.
Ask for personal information including occupation and interests.
Understand very basic personal profiles from social networks or similar.
Complete a very basic personal profile for a social network or  similar.
Family Friends Age Numbers to 100 More occupations More interests and hobbies.

S/he’s a / an How old are you? How old is s/he?
S/he likes … S/he likes to …
S/he’s from S/he lives in …

Basic personal information Small talk about friends and family.
Do you have any brothers or sisters?
What does s/he do?

/^/ = mother brother husband son.
More linking with an.
Understand questions and conversations about friends and family.
Carry out conversations and ask questions about friends and family.
Understand brief descriptions of friends and family.
Complete a brief description of an important friend or family member.
More Interests Friends and Acquaintances Hobbies Sports Personal adjectives.

Verb to be with personal pronouns We, they.
Negatives.
I don’t like… I’m not… S/he doesn’t like… S/he’s not… They don’t like… They’re not…

Simple conversations about other people.
Who’s s/he? Who are they?
S/he live in … They live in…
S/he likes / doesn’t like… They like / don’t like…
S/he’s /They’re.... S/he’s not… They’re not….
Word stress.

Understand short conversations about other people.
Understand descriptions of people.

Ask about and describe other people.
Carry out brief conversations about acquaintances and friends.
Understand brief descriptions of peoples’ personalities, hobbies and interests.
Write a short description of an individual, his or her personality, hobbies and interests.
Going out Events Activities Places Location Days of the week, dates and time.
Describing events and places with there’s / there are Specifying time and date with It’s at… It’s on…
Invitations with Would you like to…?     Accepting and declining invitations.     Suggestions with Let’s…
Intonation and sentence stress using key words.
Understand invitations to events and places.     Understand times and dates.

Make suggestions and invitations to events and places.
Accept or decline invitations and suggestions for going out.
Understand announcements of events.
Write an announcement of or invitation to an event.
Possessions Clothing Style Physical appearance.
Verb have Possessive pronouns my, your, his and her.

I like to wear…
I use…
Vowels /aI/, /I/, /e/

Understand physical descriptions of people.
Understand descriptions of personal possessions and objects.

Describe people’s style and physical appearance.
Describe personal possessions.
Understand brief descriptions from webpages about physical appearance.
Write a brief description of an individual’s physical appearance to match a picture.
Everyday routines and activities Days of the week Times Making appointments.
Simple present Adverbs of frequency.

Are you busy?
Can you meet…?
I’m sorry, I have an appointment.
Word stress.

Understand descriptions of routines, habits and activities.
Understand conversations about making appointments.

Describe daily and weekly routines.
Interview a person about his or her daily and weekly routine.
Make on appointment.

Understand a weekly schedule.
Understand a brief description of a person’s daily and weekly routine.

Write about your daily and weekly routine.
Write and answer an e-mail about making an appointment.

Free time activities.
Travel plans.
Present progressive for present activities and future plans.

What are you doing this weekend?
Where are you going on vacation?
Understand conversations about present activities and future plans.
Describe present activities and future plans.
Understand short descriptions of vacation plans.
Read and answer an email about weekend and vacation plans.
